presentation_text: We encourage all participants on the call this morning to access the live webcast and supporting materials at Plexus's website at www.plexus.com, clicking on Investors at the top of that page.

speaker_title_P: Vice President, Communications and Investor Relations
presentation_text: In order to maintain appropriate social distancing, we are again conducting this quarter's call virtually.

speaker_title_P: Vice President, Communications and Investor Relations
presentation_text: Joining me today are Todd Kelsey, President and Chief Executive Officer, Steve Frisch, Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer, and Pat Germain, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.

speaker_title_P: Vice President, Communications and Investor Relations
presentation_text: Consistent with prior earnings calls, Todd will provide summary comments before turning the call over to Steve and Pat for further details.

speaker_title_P: Vice President, Communications and Investor Relations
presentation_text: Let me now turn the call over to Todd Kelsey.

speaker_title_P: Vice President, Communications and Investor Relations
presentation_text: Todd?

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Thank you, Sean, and good morning, everyone.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please begin on slide three.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I will start with an introduction of recent changes impacting our investor relations team.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: First, you may have noticed a familiar name and voice introducing our call.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'm pleased to welcome Sean Harrison to the Plexus team as our Vice President of Communications and Investor Relations.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Sean brings tremendous experience to Plexus as a well-respected sell-side analyst, previously with Loop Capital and Longbow Research.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: He has a 20-year history covering Plexus and knows us well.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'm very excited for Sean to leverage his expertise in furthering Plexus's investor relations program.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Next, many of you have gotten to know and respect Heather Beresford over the last two and a half years for her leadership within our investor relations team.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Heather has done a great job in taking our investor relations, corporate communications, and branding to a new level.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I am pleased to inform you that as a result of her exceptional work and capabilities, Heather has been promoted to Vice President of Aftermarket Services.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I look forward to Heather leveraging her leadership to further our operational performance in this growing and differentiated service offering.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide four for a discussion of our fiscal first quarter results.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our operations achieved strong results in the fiscal first quarter of 2021.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We expanded our industry-leading gap operating margin to 5.6 percent through our focus on productivity improvements and expense management, along with solid performance from our engineering solutions team.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: This result includes 64 basis points of stock-based compensation expense and represents the third consecutive quarter of GAAP operating margin in excess of 5%.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We achieved quarterly revenue of $830 million, which was in line with our expectations and at the midpoint of our guidance range.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our industrial sector exceeded our expectations entering the quarter, primarily as a result of upside from semiconductor capital equipment customers.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our healthcare life sciences sector also exceeded expectations as we saw modest improvement in demand for equipment used for elective procedures.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Finally, aerospace and defense underperformed to forecast due to the impact of COVID-19 on commercial aerospace and program ramp delays.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Through this combination of strong operating performance and inline revenue, we delivered GAAP-diluted earnings per share of $1.23, including 18 cents of stock-based compensation expense, which was well above the top end of our guidance range.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'm extremely proud of our GlobalPlexus team as they continue to deliver outstanding results while navigating the complexity stemming from COVID-19.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide five.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Next, I will discuss additional accomplishments within the fiscal first quarter of 2021, starting with the recent successes of our go-to-market team.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: While navigating the pandemic, our go-to-market team has successfully leveraged our reputation as the leader in highly complex products and demanding regulatory environments to produce several consecutive quarters of strong wins results.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our team delivered fiscal first quarter manufacturing wins of $223 million when fully ramped into production.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The quarterly wins included six new logos, an uncommonly high number.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: This result highlights the success of our innovative virtual business development efforts, underscores the market recognition of our strong performance during the pandemic, and provides significant opportunity for future growth.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our trailing four-quarter manufacturing wins now exceed $1 billion for the first time in history.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In addition, we expanded Plexus' funnel of qualified manufacturing opportunities by nearly $600 million from the previous quarter, as our teams are quite successful in moving leads into qualified opportunities.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The end result is a record $3.3 billion funnel of opportunities that aligns well with our strategy.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Further, our engineering funnel increased to its highest level in nearly two years.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The engineering funnel is a good leading indicator for future manufacturing wins and additional margin expansion opportunities.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our healthy rate of new program wins and the considerable expansion in the funnel of qualified manufacturing and engineering opportunities should position us well to achieve our 9 to 12 percent revenue CAGR goal over the longer term.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Next, turning to some operational highlights.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our engineering solutions utilization strengthened considerably in the quarter as the team engaged in several revolutionary new product development efforts and product launches.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our customers recognize the value we provide through our differentiated service offering where we help create the products that build a better world.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our engineering solutions team remains a strong contributor to Plexus's profitability and manufacturing growth.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our manufacturing operations team continued their march toward their aspirational goal of zero defects and perfect delivery while achieving productivity improvements and driving effective cost management.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The end result has been the delivery of customer service excellence and a sustained expansion of our industry-leading GAAP operating margin.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Finally, our aftermarket services team exceeded expectations, delivering strong revenue and operating income during the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We view aftermarket services as a critical offering in order to provide value throughout the product lifecycle and create sustainable solutions for our customers, as well as an opportunity to further expand margins.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Advancing to our guidance for the fiscal second quarter of 2021 on slide six.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We anticipate a robust fiscal second quarter due to expected increases in medical equipment demand and near-term strengthening in our industrial sector.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The healthcare life sciences improvements are broad-based, with 17 of our top 20 customers increasing their fiscal second quarter forecast from what we anticipated one quarter ago.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: While the semiconductor capital equipment subsector is a significant portion of the industrial expansion, the sector is showing additional strength, with 14 of our top 20 customers increasing their fiscal second quarter forecast during this cycle.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Taking these circumstances into consideration, we're getting revenue of $860 to $900 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: As a result of effective expense control and the efforts of our operations team in driving sustainable productivity gains, we're getting gap operating margin in the range of 5 to 5.5 percent, including 73 basis points of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: With this strong performance, we anticipate delivering gap-diluted earnings per share of $1.17 to $1.32, including $0.22 of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our guidance assumes that COVID-19 will not materially impact end markets or our operations beyond what has already occurred.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I will close with a few thoughts regarding fiscal 2021.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In the near term, we have seen demand strengthening across several of our end markets, resulting in an improved revenue outlook for the fiscal second quarter.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Long-term visibility into end markets remains limited, yet our history of strong execution provides the opportunity to continue to capture any potential upside demand that may arise.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Looking to the second half of fiscal 2021, Based off current customer forecasts, we anticipate quarterly revenue relatively consistent with the fiscal second quarter guidance range and operating margin to moderate from the fiscal first quarter result.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our ability to manage changes in demand, our ongoing focus on productivity improvements, and our robust first half outlook has positioned Plexus to drive strong EPS growth for fiscal 2021.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I will now turn the call over to Steve for additional analysis of the performance of our market sectors and operations.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Steve.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Thank you, Todd.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Good morning.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I will start on slide seven with a review of the performance of our market sectors for the fiscal first quarter of 2021, as well as our expectations for the fiscal second quarter of 2021.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Revenue within our industrial sector decreased 12 percent for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The result was better than our expectations of a low teens decline.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Stronger demand from almost all of our semiconductor capital equipment customers drove the improvement.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As we look at the fiscal second quarter, we are seeing double-digit forecast increases from several semiconductor capital equipment customers.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition, there are pockets of growing demand within our energy management and industrial equipment subsectors, but the recent strength in our communications subsector is subsiding.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The net result is that we anticipate a mid-single-digit increase for our industrial sector in the fiscal second quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our healthcare life sciences revenue declined 7% in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The result was slightly better than our expectations of a high single-digit decrease.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Looking at the fiscal second quarter, two recently ramped testers that can detect viruses, including COVID-19, are reaching full production rates.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition, there has been a resurgence in the demand for a critical care device used in the treatment for COVID-19 patients and modest forecast increases with some elective procedure products.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As a result, we expect a high single-digit increase for our healthcare life science sector in the fiscal second quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Revenue in our aerospace and defense sector was down 6% in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The result was meaningfully short of our expectations of a mid-single-digit increase.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Production challenges with a ramping space program, as well as further degradation in some commercial aerospace programs, were the cause for the lower revenue.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Looking at the fiscal second quarter, Forecasting from customers within the sector varies significantly as they push and pull demand to meet changing end markets.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: However, our diversification dampens the overall volatility, and the net result is we are anticipating a low single-digit increase for our aerospace and defense sector in the fiscal second quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide eight for an overview of our WINS performance for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We won 35 new manufacturing programs that we expect to generate $223 million in annualized revenue when fully ramped into production.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The mix of wins between existing and new customers was well balanced within the quarter, with 21 of the wins coming from current customers and 14 as a result of new relationships.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the 14 new relationships are the addition of six new logos and the expansion into new divisions with eight of our customers.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The continued strong winds performance drove our trailing four-quarter winds to a record level in excess of $1 billion.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: At that magnitude, our winds momentum stands at a very robust 30 percent, which is above our 25 percent goal and supports our long-term growth strategy.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We can advance to slide nine to review the manufacturing winds by region for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The manufacturing winds were well balanced across all three regions, which allowed each of them to maintain or increase their trailing four-quarter winds performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The Americas region winds at $89 million maintains the region's trailing four-quarter winds at a healthy $447 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Winds of $93 million for the APAC region increased their trailing four-quarter winds by 8% to close at $391 million, while the winds in EMEA at $41 million grew their trailing four-quarter winds by 19% to reach $171 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The balanced WINS performance supports each of the regional growth goals over the long term.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide 10 for further insight into the manufacturing WINS performance by market sector.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The number of WINS per sector was well distributed, and each sector had a healthy mix of WINS between customers and new relationships.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The industrial sector matched their robust manufacturing WINS performance from the previous quarter by securing another $108 million in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The wins were generated from 13 opportunities with eight coming from customers and five from new relationships.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our healthcare life sciences team produced a healthy wins result of $81 million in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The mix of the team's wins, 14 wins, were nine from customers and five from new relationships.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The aerospace and defense sector captured eight manufacturing wins totaling $34 million in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The wins were equally split between customers and new relationships.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Looking at the fiscal second quarter, we believe the adjustments we have made to our business development process will continue to overcome the challenges that COVID-19 creates and will support continued healthy wins performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide 11 for further insight into some of the fiscal first quarter wins.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the Healthcare Life Sciences WINS is a Class III medical device that is used in the treatment of coronary heart disease.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The device is being designed by our engineering solutions team and will be produced in our Penang, Malaysia healthcare center facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The Healthcare Life Sciences team also won the manufacturing of an existing anesthesia program from a current customer.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The production of the device will be transferred from a competitor to our facilities in Penang, Malaysia and Guadalajara, Mexico.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our healthcare facility in Guadalajara will also be producing products for a new healthcare life sciences customer who is focused on allergy detection and management.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We expect this product to start ramping this fiscal year.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the industrial wins is a new customer who produces instrumentation used in advanced manufacturing process control.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The family of products will be manufactured in our Xiamen China facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our industrial team also won the production of another air purification system.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our team in EMEA is assisting this new customer with commercialization of the product.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We expect to start ramping the device in our Kelso Scotland facility later this year.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the aerospace and defense winds are two new drone programs from an existing customer.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: These products will be produced in our Penang, Malaysia Aerospace Center of Excellence facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our aftermarket services team closed the first two opportunities from a healthcare life science customer who has decided to outsource the services portion of their business.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The first two engagements are in the Americas and EMEA, but there is potential to expand the relationship into APAC as well.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We can proceed to slide 12 for highlights of our funnel of qualified manufacturing opportunities.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our sector teams expanded the funnel by an impressive $574 million during the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The 21% growth within the quarter increased the funnel to almost $3.3 billion.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Contributing to the funnel's increase are two opportunities from customers who are shifting their manufacturing strategy from internal production to an outsource model.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our industrial sector grew $271 million, or 57% in the fiscal first quarter, to close their funnel at $743 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The resource investments in fiscal 2020 and the team's focus on advancing leads into qualified opportunities are driving the growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The healthcare life sciences sector significantly expanded their funnel for the second straight quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The team increased the funnel by $262 million in the fiscal first quarter to close at almost $1.9 billion.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our team's ability to continue to deliver in spite of volatility that COVID-19 has created is being rewarded by our customers providing us additional opportunities.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our aerospace and defense sector increased their funnel by $42 million in the fiscal first quarter to finish at $667 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Their funnel has now grown to the largest it has been in four years.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Next, I would like to turn to operating performance on slide 13.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As Todd highlighted, our team produced a strong gap operating margin of 5.6% in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our manufacturing team's focus on operational efficiency provided the foundation for the robust performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In the fiscal first quarter, two teams built on top of that solid foundation to deliver the outstanding result.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our aftermarket services team did an exceptional job of aligning investments with revenue growth, and our engineering solutions team worked tirelessly through the holiday season to meet customer demand.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Both of these activities contributed to us outperforming our original operating margin expectations.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As we look to the fiscal second quarter, we expect our strong operational performance to overcome our typical seasonal headwinds to deliver strong GAAP operating margin in the range of 5 to 5.5 percent.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The team delivering this result would mark the fourth straight quarter of GAAP operating margin in excess of 5 percent.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: A few final comments.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I talk regularly about the path to success being relentless focus on operational excellence and customer service excellence.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: There will always be opportunities for improvement, but I am proud of the Plexus team for pushing themselves and each other to fulfill on these commitments.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: It is their passion for excellence that produced the strong fiscal first quarter results and enabled a healthy fiscal second quarter guidance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I would like to thank each of the Plexus employees for their dedication to continuous improvement.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition to making Plexus a better company, you are truly making the world a better place.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Thank you.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I will now turn the call to Pat for an in-depth review of our financial performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Pat?

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Thank you, Steve, and good morning, everyone.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Our fiscal first quarter results are summarized on slide 14.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: First quarter revenue of $830 million was at the midpoint of our guidance, while gross margin of 9.5% hit the top end of our guidance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Better than expected gross margin primarily related to an improvement in business mix and our focus on expense management.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We delivered better performance from our higher value-added services, which include engineering and aftermarket services.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Gross margin also improved due to lower-than-anticipated spending related to healthcare costs and travel expenses.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Selling and administrative expenses of $32.4 million were favorable to our guidance and $6.4 million lower than the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: the majority of the sequential decline related to a reduction in incentive compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: In addition, we recovered $2.3 million of a previously reserved customer receivable.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This recovery had been contemplated in our first quarter guidance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Our gap operating margin of 5.6% was above our guidance due to a combination of improved gross margin and lower SG&A spending.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This is the third consecutive quarter with operating margin above 5%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Non-operating expenses of $5.2 million were slightly above expectations as a result of foreign exchange losses.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Gap diluted EPS of $1.23 was above the top end of our guidance range, primarily due to the strong operational performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Turning now to our cash flow and balance sheet on slide 15.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: As anticipated for the fiscal first quarter, we made investments in working capital.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We delivered $7 million in cash from operations and spent $16 million on capital expenditures, resulting in negative free cash flow of $9 million, which was in line with expectations.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: During the fiscal first quarter, we purchased approximately 307,000 shares of our stock for $22.8 million, at an average price of $74.16 per share.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We completed the $50 million program authorized in 2019 and commenced purchasing shares under our new program authorized last year.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This program totals $100 million and has approximately $83 million remaining under it.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We expect to execute the repurchases on a consistent basis throughout fiscal 2021 while taking market conditions into consideration.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At quarter end, cash totaled $357 million, sequentially lower by $31 million, due in part to our investments in working capital, capital expenditures, and our expanded share repurchase program.

presentation_text: Our robust fiscal second quarter results highlight the advantages of our unique value proposition and consistent focus on operational excellence.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, Plexus Corp.

presentation_text: At the end of the fiscal third quarter, we had approximately $26 million remaining under our authorization, We intend to purchase the remaining amount during our fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: With our commitment to returning all excess cash to shareholders, we will soon be reviewing with our board of directors our plans for a new program once the current authorization is completed.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We believe Plexus is well positioned with a strong balance sheet.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At quarter end, cash totaled approximately $307 million, sequentially higher by $13 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal third quarter, we delivered a return on invested capital of 15.9%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This result generated an economic return of 780 basis points above our weighted average cost of capital creating solid shareholder value.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At quarter end, we were pleased with our cash cycle, which was consistent with our guidance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer

presentation_text: Sequentially, inventory days increased by 19, the increase in days primarily related to the reduced revenue for the fiscal third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer

presentation_text: We expect to gain better leverage on our fixed costs with the anticipated sequential increase in revenue.

presentation_text: For the fiscal fourth quarter, we expect SG&A expense in the range of $39 to $40 million.

presentation_text: Again, increased revenue should provide added leverage.

presentation_text: At our Board of Directors meeting next month, we will be revisiting our future operating margin target and we'll share more details during our October earnings call.

presentation_text: In fiscal 2021, our team delivered over $1 billion of new manufacturing revenue when fully ramped into production, an increase of 8% over the previous year.

presentation_text: In addition, our team engaged with a greater than typical 22 new customers during fiscal 2021.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: These engagements create a significant opportunity to drive incremental new program wins and, in turn, revenue growth in future quarters.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Finally, we ended the year with a qualified funnel of manufacturing and aftermarket services opportunities at a record $3.3 billion, as well as an increasing funnel of engineering opportunities.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide four.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'm also proud of the continued progress of our environmental, social, and governance program.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'll provide highlights of fiscal 2021 activities within our social pillar Within this pillar, we advanced our efforts to support our local communities as well as the development, inclusivity, and engagement of our team members who create our best Plexus.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We created a positive impact on our communities through our charitable giving of nearly $1 million, our promotion of STEM education, and our encouragement of volunteerism through establishing a paid time off program available to all Plexus team members globally.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: These efforts support a virtual cycle of well-being in our lives.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In addition, we expanded our team member-driven employee resource groups, including Plexus Young Professionals, which fosters team member development, Unus Plexus, which celebrates Plexus's diversity in different cultures, and Women in Network, which champions the advancement of women professionally and personally.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: These groups aid in facilitating our goal that all Plexus team members reach their full potential.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide five for a discussion of our fiscal fourth quarter results.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We delivered fiscal fourth quarter gap EPS of $1.16 and gap operating margin of 5%.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: These results were comfortably in our guidance range despite revenue falling below our expectations, which finished at $843 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Worsening supply chain constraints and labor reductions in Malaysia as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic negatively impacted revenue.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our GAAP EPS, which included 23 cents of stock-based compensation expense, benefited from a focus on cost control, a strong start of a new aftermarket services program, and continued robust demand for our engineering solutions globally.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: The fiscal fourth quarter labor availability challenges in Malaysia were a result of confirmed COVID-19 infections and mandated close contact quarantines, which includes vaccinated individuals in Malaysia.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Amazingly, our Malaysia team is now nearly 100% vaccinated.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In addition, as of today, the infection rates in Malaysia have reduced significantly and our operations located there are running near normal.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Given these facts, we do not expect the COVID-19 pandemic to impact our fiscal first quarter workforce availability in Malaysia.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide six.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: As we look to the first quarter of fiscal 2022, the demand environment remains robust, particularly within our healthcare life sciences and industrial market sectors.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: However, constraints in the component market continue, limiting our ability to grow revenue in the near term.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: As a result, we are establishing a revenue guidance range of $825 to $865 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our demand exceeds this guidance range by well over $100 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We expect continued strong operating performance and our guiding gap operating margin in the range of 4.6 to 5%, including 70 basis points of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: At these revenue and operating margin levels, we anticipate delivering gap diluted earnings per share of $1.01 to $1.17, including 21 cents of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Our guidance assumes supply chain constraints and COVID-19, including potential vaccination and testing mandates, do not further materially impact end markets or our operations.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Next, a few thoughts regarding our longer-term outlook.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Looking at our end markets, we see strong demand within healthcare life sciences over the next several quarters, led by a recovery for equipment related to elective procedures.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Likewise, our industrial sector is showing significant strength, led by semiconductor capital equipment and communications customers.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We believe our aerospace and defense sector revenue will begin to move higher, driven by improvement in the commercial aerospace market.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In addition to strong in-market demand, we are major participants in secular growth markets, such as robotic-assisted surgery, warehouse and factory automation, and commercial space.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Furthermore, we benefit from the differentiation provided by our engineering and aftermarket service offerings that allow Plexus to support the full product lifecycle.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In summary, we remain optimistic in our outlook.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: As we look to fiscal 2022, customer demand remains robust as a result of improved end markets, new program wins, and our participation in secular growth markets, and far exceeds our 9% to 12% revenue growth goal.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: However, supply chain constraints will limit our ability to fulfill all demand.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: We continue to believe that we will achieve quarterly sequential revenue growth and expansion of our industry-leading gap operating margin as the fiscal year progresses.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: In closing, I'd like to thank our Plexus team for their outstanding efforts in fiscal 2021.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: It is through their talents and dedication that we're able to further our vision of helping to create the products that build a better world while delivering for all of our stakeholders.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: I'll now turn the call over to Steve for additional analysis of the performance of our market sectors and operations.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer
presentation_text: Steve.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Thank you, Todd.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Good morning.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I will start on slide seven with a review of the fiscal fourth quarter and the full fiscal year performance of our market sectors for 2021, as well as our expectations for the sectors for the fiscal first quarter of 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Customer demand across our market sectors was very robust in 2021, including the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: However, global supply chain constraints, as well as operational inefficiencies due to COVID-19 in our Malaysia operations were worse than anticipated.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As a result, all three of our sectors missed revenue expectations for the fiscal fourth quarter, largely due to these challenges.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In spite of the many obstacles in fiscal 2021, our healthcare life sciences and industrial sectors achieved annual revenue growth of 5% and 2%, respectively.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: This was largely due to successfully ramping new programs throughout the year.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Although our aerospace and defense sector was also ramping new programs, the headwinds associated with commercial aerospace were too large to overcome.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The result in revenue is a decline of almost 20% for our aerospace and defense sector.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The net result is the team's generated Plexus revenue in fiscal 2021 that was slightly below our record of $3.4 billion in fiscal 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As we start fiscal 2022, we believe the COVID-19 situation in Malaysia is improving.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: However, the global supply chain constraints will limit our ability to capture the broad-based, robust demand from customers in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Looking at our industrial sector, demand in most subsectors, including semiconductor capital equipment, warehouse automation, and communications, remain strong.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: However, supply chain constraints are limiting our ability to realize the full potential.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As a result, we expect a low single-digit decrease in our industrial sector for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In our healthcare life sciences sector, a new ramp of an aftermarket services program and a robotic-assisted medical device are enabling growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The result is we expect a mid-single digit increase for our healthcare life science sector in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Customer forecasts in our aerospace and defense sector are strengthening.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We expect the commercial aerospace and commercial space subsectors to continue to increase this trend in fiscal 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Unfortunately, supply chain challenges are limiting our ability to capture the demand within the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As a result, we expect a low single digit decrease for our aerospace and defense sector in the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide eight for an overview of our wins performance for the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We won 38 new manufacturing programs that we expect to generate $251 million in annualized revenue when fully ramped into production.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: For fiscal 2021, the wins total exceeded $1 billion, which is a fiscal year record.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition, the strong wins performance throughout fiscal 2021 increased our wins momentum, which is defined as the trailing four quarters of wins divided by the trailing four quarters of revenue.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: At 31%, the WINS momentum is well beyond our 25% goal and supports our growth strategy.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We can advance to slide 9 to review the manufacturing WINS by region for the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The Americas Region WINS were an impressive $142 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The strong WINS result was driven by programs that either require or strongly desire a U.S.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: manufacturing solution.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In spite of the COVID-19 distraction during the quarter, the APAC region had wins of $62 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The region's track record of strong performance is supporting new wins in spite of the inability for customers to easily visit these sites.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The major region finished fiscal 2021 with their highest quarterly wins of $47 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the wins are two new logos that we expect to ramp within fiscal 2022 in our Kelso Scotland facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide 10 for further insight into the manufacturing winds performance by market sector.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The industrial sector winds increased to $87 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Robust winds in the semiconductor capital equipment and communications subsectors enabled this stronger result.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our healthcare life sciences sector generated $44 million in winds in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Although a lower than typical winds result for the sector, it is partly a timing issue, and we anticipate a meaningful increase in the fiscal first quarter winds for the sector.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The aerospace and defense sector had exceptionally strong winds to only $120 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: New programs in the commercial space subsector enabled the strong outcome.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: These winds drove a 31% or $61 million increase in the sector's trailing four-quarter winds.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: which closed the fiscal fourth quarter at a very healthy $258 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Please advance to slide 11 for further insight into some of the fiscal fourth quarter wins.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Including industrial wins is a next generation cable access program that our customer has decided to dual source with their internal manufacturing to mitigate long-term business continuity risk.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The product will be produced by our Guadalajara, Mexico operations.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The industrial team also added a new communications customer who produces a broad portfolio of connectivity products.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our team in Penang, Malaysia will be producing the first assembly, a data compression and security product, with this new customer.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition to these communication opportunities, the industrial sector expanded market share with an existing semiconductor capital equipment customer.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The products, which are used in the front-end processing of semiconductor wafers, will be built in our Portland, Oregon and our Guadalajara, Mexico facilities.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The Healthcare Life Sciences team expanded our portfolio in the differentiated market of robotic-assisted medical instruments with another meaningful win from an existing customer.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: This new device will be produced in our Neenah, Wisconsin facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The Healthcare Life Sciences team also added a diagnostic tester program from a new customer in the Emea region.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The COVID PCR tester will be produced in our Kelso, Scotland facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Included in the aerospace and WINS are two satellite communication programs that we expect to add meaningful revenue to our growing space subsector.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The first opportunity significantly expands our relationship with a customer in our Boise, Idaho facility, while the second opportunity is with a new customer for our Kelso, Scotland facility.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: With this latest WIN in EMEA, we expect to be producing commercial space programs in all three of our regions in fiscal 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We can proceed to slide 12 for highlights of our funnel of qualified manufacturing opportunities.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our funnel grew over $200 million in the fiscal fourth quarter to finish at a record $3.3 billion.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Our industrial sector led the increase by expanding their funnel by an impressive $265 million to close the fiscal fourth quarter at $938 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Three larger RF communication programs from an existing customer drove the significant increase.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The healthcare life sciences sector held their funnel at a very healthy $1.7 billion.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Two larger manufacturing opportunities, including an ultrasound device and a robotic-assisted medical device, were the significant new program ads in the quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition to the exceptional wins in the fiscal fourth quarter, the aerospace and defense sector added $37 million to their funnel to exit fiscal 2021 with a robust funnel of $708 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: New opportunities in the commercial and defense subsectors not only backfilled the winds, but fueled the funnel's growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Next, I would like to turn to operating performance on slide 13.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The highlight of the fiscal fourth quarter and the full fiscal year of 2021 for me is the team's operational performance in the midst of a global pandemic.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The team's ability to generate GAAP operating margin of 5% for the fiscal fourth quarter and 5.2% for the full fiscal year is outstanding.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The performance and result of teamwork are manufacturing, engineering, aftermarket services, market sector, supply chain, and corporate teams collaborated and supported each other.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Each time a new challenge presented itself, the team rallied to mitigate the issue for our customers and our shareholders.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: As we look to the fiscal first quarter, the teamwork carries on.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: We continue to make investments in new program ramps and facilities that will enable future growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition, we continue to maintain additional resources to help mitigate component constraint challenges and the operational inefficiencies COVID-19 has created.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Even with the additional burdens, the team is committed to working together to deliver strong operating results with operating margin in the range of 4.6 to 5% for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: A few final comments.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I typically highlight an example of dedication and outstanding performance of a Plexus team each quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: This quarter, our customers have done it for me.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: In addition to a recent letter of commendation from one of our largest healthcare life sciences customers regarding exceptional performance during the pandemic, one of our largest industrial customers presented us with a supplier award for outstanding performance as well.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I will leave you with a few of the remarks that came with the award.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: The customer noted that they would like to recognize Plexus for outstanding performance responding to an unprecedented ramp during the global COVID crisis.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: They also commented that we increased capacity by 160% amid continuous disruptions in labor, material, and equipment availability.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I believe the customer captured their current environment very well and how our teams are responding.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I would like to thank the Plexus team for not just their efforts each day, but for the results they are creating.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: I will now turn the call to Pat for an in-depth review of our financial performance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer
presentation_text: Pat.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Thank you, Steve, and good morning, everyone.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Our fiscal fourth quarter results are summarized on slide 14.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Fourth quarter revenue of $843 million was sequentially higher by 4%, while gross margin of 9.4% was sequentially higher by 30 basis points.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Fiscal fourth quarter gross profit improved in all three of our regions compared to the fiscal third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Better business mix, cost management, and labor efficiency led to the improvement.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Selling an administrative expense of $36.6 million was favorable to our guidance, primarily due to strong cost control efforts given the lower than expected revenue, along with the reduction in incentive compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: As a percentage of revenue, SG&A was 4.3 percent, which was better than expected and sequentially improved by approximately 20 basis points.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Our GAAP operating margin of 5 percent was 50 basis points higher than last quarter, marking a return to an operating margin of 5% or better.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Included in the fiscal fourth quarter operating margin was approximately 80 basis points of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: With the fiscal fourth quarter result, we have now generated operating margin at or above 5% for five of the last six quarters.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We ended a challenging fiscal 2021 with industry-leading gap operating margin of 5.2%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Non-operating expenses of $2.9 million were favorable to expectations due to foreign exchange gains and lower interest expense.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Diluted gap EPS of $1.16 was slightly below the midpoint of our guidance.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: With sequential revenue growth of 4%, fiscal fourth quarter diluted gap EPS improved 22%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the full year, revenue was relatively flat compared to fiscal 2020, while GAAP diluted EPS improved an impressive 21%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Turning now to our cash flow and balance sheet on slide 15.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal fourth quarter, we were pleased with our cash flow results.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We delivered $11 million in cash from operations, and spent $23 million on capital expenditures, resulting in fiscal fourth quarter cash usage of $12 million, a result favorable to our expectations.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal year, we delivered $142 million in cash from operations and spent $57 million on capital expenditures, generating free cash flow of $85 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We were pleased to see all three of our regions generate positive free cash flow in fiscal 2021 a first in many years.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: During the fiscal fourth quarter, we purchased approximately 331,000 shares of our stock for $29.3 million at an average price of $88.39 per share.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At year end, we had $47 million remaining under our current $50 million authorization.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We expect to execute the repurchases on a consistent basis throughout fiscal 2022 while taking market conditions into consideration.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We ended the year with a strong balance sheet.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Cash totaled $271 million, while total debt was $253 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We had $55 million outstanding under our $350 million revolving credit facility, and our gross debt to EBITDA leverage ratio of one was at an attractive level.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal year, we delivered return on invested capital of 15.4%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This result generated an economic return of 730 basis points above our weighted average cost of capital, creating substantial shareholder value.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Strong operating performance while maintaining consistent year-over-year average invested capital led to 140 basis point improvement in ROIC compared to fiscal 2020.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Cash cycle at the end of the fiscal fourth quarter was 85 days consistent with our guidance and five days higher than our results in the fiscal third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Please turn to slide 16 for details on our cash cycle.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Sequentially, inventory days increased by eight.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: The increase in days was indicative of the challenging supply chain environment our industry is facing.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Extended component lead times are requiring us to procure inventory earlier to improve our ability to meet customer demand.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At the same time, volatility in supplier deliveries is impacting our ability to manufacture and deliver product to our customers.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Essentially offsetting the increase in inventory days were increases in both payable days and customer deposit days.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: With elevated purchasing activity, payable days sequentially increased by five.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Customer deposit days increased by two, two days, as we worked with customers to offset inventory purchases.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Days and receivables were 56 days, sequentially higher by four days.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: The increase was primarily due to the timing of shipments and a reduction in receivables sold under a customer factoring program.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: As Todd has already provided the revenue and EPS guidance for the fiscal first quarter, I'll review some additional details which are summarized on slide 17.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Fiscal first quarter gross margin is expected to be in the range of 8.9 to 9.3%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At the midpoint of this guidance, gross margin would be sequentially lower by 30 basis points, primarily due to lowered leverage of our fixed costs.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: With revenue anticipated to be consistent with fiscal fourth quarter, fixed costs are expected to increase as we invest in support of future growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal first quarter, we expect SG&A expense in the range of $36.5 to $37.5 million, which is relatively consistent with fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At the midpoint of our revenue guidance, anticipated SG&A would be 4.4% of revenue, slightly higher than the fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Fiscal first quarter gap operating margin is expected to be in the range of 4.6 to 5%, which includes approximately 70 basis points of stock-based compensation expense.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At the midpoint of this guidance, gap operating margin would be 4.8%, sequentially lower by 20 basis points.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: During our annual planning process this past August, we revisited our long-term gap operating margin target and decided to increase it from the previous range of 4.7 to 5% and establish a new target of 5.5%.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Considerations in determining the new target included our ability to leverage fixed costs given the demand outlook, our improved business mix, and permanent gains made in reducing transformation costs during the past 18 months while continuing to invest in the business to support future growth.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We expect to make sequential progress towards achieving this target as we move through fiscal 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: A few other notes for the fiscal first quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Depreciation and amortization expense is expected to be approximately $16 million, slightly higher than the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Non-operating expenses are expected to be in the range of $3.8 to $4.2 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We are estimating an effective tax rate of 13 to 15 percent and diluted shares outstanding of approximately 28.7 million shares.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Our expectation for the balance sheet is that working capital investments will increase compared to the fiscal fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Based on our revenue forecast, we expect this level of working capital will result in cash cycle days of 94 to 98 days.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: At the midpoint of this guidance, cash cycle would increase 11 days compared to the fiscal fourth quarter, primarily due to inventory requirements.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: The constrained supply chain environment and extended lead times have required additional investments in inventory to satisfy customer demand.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We continue to work closely with our customers to secure deposits to minimize working capital investments.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We are also investing in working capital to support anticipated sequential growth as we move through fiscal 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: We are taking the necessary measures now in order to fulfill our customers' demand even if that results in added working capital investments.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal first quarter, we expect free cash flow to be negative as we make needed investments in working capital and capital additions.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: Capital spending for fiscal 2022 is expected to be in the range of $100 to $120 million.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: This includes approximately $50 million for our new Thailand facility, which is anticipated to open during our fiscal third quarter of 2022.

speaker_title_P: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
presentation_text: For the fiscal year, we anticipate free cash flow in the range of break-even to a usage of cash in support of our investments.
